title: >>> It DOES Matter If You're BLACK or WHITE
body_text:
The long-awaited, tenevent worthy matchup featuring two of the absolute best the sport has to offer ... the accomplished and respected veteran
Kevin Adams
against the fastest rising star of the modern era
Grant Cornero
.
This is how you begin what could be the most crucial time period perhaps in dodgeball's incredible history. DODGEBALL LXXXVI had all the ingredients of a true classic. Violent, painful faceshots, super-glue and even one-handed catches, magnificent dodging displays, and above all else, the drive and heart of every competitor.
Match Summary
We've all heard it ... "an evenly contested bout, that could have gone either way." But it's a perfect fit to one extraordinary night.
The arduous three-hour clash of warriors began with Grant and his so-called BLACK Team picking up the kick-off game of LXXXVI. A fine start for the inexperienced captain.
Come Game 2, the initial success Grant earned was taken away almost immediately, as the veteran Kevin and the WHITE Team fought long and hard the next couple of rounds. At the end of four, it was 3 to 1, a solid lead in favor of the Season 1 veteran Adams. With time still remaining, anything was possible.
LXXXVI's final two contests came down to the wire. Combatants were on their toes during Game 5, eventually won by Grant. But it just wasn't enough as the sixth game saw the opposite - the death nail in the coffin of the BLACK Team.
2005 mogul Kevin Adams's past knowledge and strategy prevailed in this epic encounter over the resourceful and daring 2007 headliner Grant Cornero.
-->
Grant's victories
: 1, 5
-->
Kevin's victories
: 2, 3, 4, 6
Online Exclusive!
In the weeks leading up to the match, Grant became interested in picking teams under
Pick Your Poison
Rules. Kevin felt it would be best if traditional team formations applied. Grant would go on to accept regular team selections as was seen at DODGEBALL LXXXVI.
Moments & Stars
: Diana DiBuccio's two vicious faceshots in a matter of minutes; Sascha Basista's reckless and rather comedic dodges; super-glue catches from Mike "Sputz" as well as Kevin Fitzpatrick
The 86th Records
> Attendance: 20
> Biggest Return: Wesley Hebrew (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXI)
> New Players: (1) Tim Caradonio
- DODGEBALL LXXXVI took place on
Cinco de Mayo
.
- It was held on the Back Courts of Wall High School for the third consecutive week. It featured Human Rims for the second consecutive week.
- Similarly to the last few events, LXXXVI included just 6 complete games.
- DODGEBALL LXXXVI witnessed Kevin Adams's record-setting sixth captains victory overall. He is the first person in history to accomplish this feat. His record is 6-2-0. This was Grant's debut match.
COMING UP NEXT ...
DODGEBALL 87: Sister vs. Sister
It's a family affair at the 87th extravaganza! The Nogueira sisters,
Liz
and
Kathryn
face-off in yet another unpreditable clash on
The Road to 90
. Watch history unfold
May 12
.
________________________________________
_______________________
Coming June 2!
DODGEBALL 90: June 2, 2007
A bombshell announcement
... One is a respected court general who doesn't take sh*t from anybody. The other, another Season 1 lion and arguably the most all-around talent to ever compete.
Justin Pierce
meets
Tom Adams
for all the marbles at the Season 9 finale.
DODGEBALL 91: June 9, 2007
A clash of this magnitude just can't end in one night! In a special team attraction,
Tom Adams
will pairup with the legendary loud-mouth
Diana DiBuccio
to take on the combination of
Justin Pierce
and his partner, the comedic
Juan Londono
! All this mayhem and carnage contested under
CREAMation Rules
!
body_html:
The long-awaited, tenevent worthy matchup featuring two of the absolute best the sport has to offer ... the accomplished and respected veteran Kevin Adams against the fastest rising star of the modern era Grant Cornero.

This is how you begin what could be the most crucial time period perhaps in dodgeball's incredible history. DODGEBALL LXXXVI had all the ingredients of a true classic. Violent, painful faceshots, super-glue and even one-handed catches, magnificent dodging displays, and above all else, the drive and heart of every competitor.

Match Summary
We've all heard it ... "an evenly contested bout, that could have gone either way." But it's a perfect fit to one extraordinary night.

The arduous three-hour clash of warriors began with Grant and his so-called BLACK Team picking up the kick-off game of LXXXVI. A fine start for the inexperienced captain.

Come Game 2, the initial success Grant earned was taken away almost immediately, as the veteran Kevin and the WHITE Team fought long and hard the next couple of rounds. At the end of four, it was 3 to 1, a solid lead in favor of the Season 1 veteran Adams. With time still remaining, anything was possible.

LXXXVI's final two contests came down to the wire. Combatants were on their toes during Game 5, eventually won by Grant. But it just wasn't enough as the sixth game saw the opposite - the death nail in the coffin of the BLACK Team.

2005 mogul Kevin Adams's past knowledge and strategy prevailed in this epic encounter over the resourceful and daring 2007 headliner Grant Cornero.

--> Grant's victories: 1, 5
--> Kevin's victories: 2, 3, 4, 6

Online Exclusive!
In the weeks leading up to the match, Grant became interested in picking teams under Pick Your Poison Rules. Kevin felt it would be best if traditional team formations applied. Grant would go on to accept regular team selections as was seen at DODGEBALL LXXXVI.

Moments & Stars: Diana DiBuccio's two vicious faceshots in a matter of minutes; Sascha Basista's reckless and rather comedic dodges; super-glue catches from Mike "Sputz" as well as Kevin Fitzpatrick

The 86th Records
> Attendance: 20
> Biggest Return: Wesley Hebrew (Last appearance at DODGEBALL LXXXI)
> New Players: (1) Tim Caradonio

- DODGEBALL LXXXVI took place on Cinco de Mayo.
- It was held on the Back Courts of Wall High School for the third consecutive week. It featured Human Rims for the second consecutive week.
- Similarly to the last few events, LXXXVI included just 6 complete games.
- DODGEBALL LXXXVI witnessed Kevin Adams's record-setting sixth captains victory overall. He is the first person in history to accomplish this feat. His record is 6-2-0. This was Grant's debut match.

COMING UP NEXT ...
DODGEBALL 87: Sister vs. Sister
It's a family affair at the 87th extravaganza! The Nogueira sisters, Liz and Kathryn face-off in yet another unpreditable clash on The Road to 90. Watch history unfold May 12.
_______________________________________________________________

Coming June 2!


DODGEBALL 90: June 2, 2007
A bombshell announcement ... One is a respected court general who doesn't take sh*t from anybody. The other, another Season 1 lion and arguably the most all-around talent to ever compete. Justin Pierce meets Tom Adams for all the marbles at the Season 9 finale.

DODGEBALL 91: June 9, 2007
A clash of this magnitude just can't end in one night! In a special team attraction, Tom Adams will pairup with the legendary loud-mouth Diana DiBuccio to take on the combination of Justin Pierce and his partner, the comedic Juan Londono! All this mayhem and carnage contested under CREAMation Rules!
